data.Description: A specified reference identifier of this list item.
A unique identifier for this list.
A name, expressed as text, of this list item.

Agreement, contract, exchange, understanding, or transfer of cash or property that occurs between two or more parties.

A code specifying the type of trade transaction.
Information, expressed as text, for this trade transaction.
A number of Lines for this trade transaction.
A date, time, date time or other date time value for the issuance of this trade transaction.
A monetary value [specified] in this trade transaction.
A tax excluded amount for this trade Line.
A tax included amount for this trade Line.
A tax excluded unit price for this trade Line.
A tax included unit price for this trade Line.
A Uniform Resource Locator (URL) of the web location of this trade transaction.
A [Specified] code for this trade transaction.
A [Specified] text for this trade transaction.
A collection of information specific to an item being used or reported on for trade purposes.
A [Specified] code for this trade Line.
A [Specified] text for this trade Line.
A [Specified] date for this trade transaction.
A reference identifier to [Specified Class] for this trade transaction.
A reference identifier for [Specified] [Class]
A period specified in this trade transaction.
A monetary value [specified] in this trade transaction.
A trade Line included in this trade transaction.
A document associated with this trade transaction, such as the purchase order, invoice or packing list.
Trade settlement details applicable to this trade transaction.
A product group included in this trade transaction.
A product included in this trade transaction.
A reference identifier to [Specified Class] for this Line.
A collection of information specific to an item being used or reported on for trade purposes.
A specified reference identifier for trade transaction including this trade Line.
A unique identifier for this trade Line.
A sequence number for this trade Line.
The unique identifier for this trade Line as assigned by the seller.
The unique identifier for this trade Line as assigned by the buyer.
A textual description of this trade Line.
A unique production batch identifier for this trade Line.
A unique product model identifier for this trade Line.
A code specifying a type of trade Line.
A measure of the gross weight (mass) of this trade Line which includes packaging but which excludes any associated transport equipment.
A measure of the net weight (mass) of this trade Line which excludes all packaging.
A measure of the gross volume of this trade Line.
A monetary value of a charge for this trade Line.
A monetary value of an invoice for this trade Line.
A number of chargeable units for this trade Line.
A measure of a chargeable weight for this trade Line.
Information, expressed as text, for this trade Line.
A measure of the net volume for this trade Line.
A name, expressed as text, for this trade Line.
A use, expressed as text, for this trade Line.
A code specifying a status of this trade Line.
A code specifying a reason for a status of this trade Line.
A code specifying a description of this trade Line.
A party for a shipment in this trade Line.
A delivery specified for this trade Line.
An actual monetary summation for this trade Line.
A total tax for this trade Line.
An accounting account for this trade Line.
The unit price details for this trade Line.
A trade Line subordinate to this trade Line, such as a reference link to a contained order item within a packing item.
A trade agreement specified for this trade Line.
A trade delivery specified for this trade Line.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Monetary Value. Functional Amount. Functional_ Amount
data.Description: A monetary value of the accounting in the function currency.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Monetary Value. Local Amount. Local_ Amount
data.Description: A monetary value of the accounting in the accounting currency local to where the accounting records are required.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Monetary Value. Reporting Amount. Reporting_ Amount
data.Description: A monetary value of the accounting in another currency, such as a reporting currency, a consolidation currency, or the euro transition period.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Monetary Value. Transaction Amount. Transaction_ Amount
data.Description: A monetary value of the accounting in the voucher currency.
A unique identifier for the individuals entering transactions into the accounting and/or ERP system.
A user's name.
A code of user's department roster.
The name of the department or division of the company to which the employee reports, expressed as text.
A code for the employee.
A code specifying a type for this employee.
A type, expressed as text, for this employee.
The highest academic degree acquired.
A date the employee was hired by their current employer.
The termination date the employee was dismissed by their current employer.
A code that describes user's job or position.
Free form description of the individual's functional role or primary responsibility.
A modified date of the user's activation or termination status.
This indicates whether the status of the user is active or inactive. A user may become inactive due to retirement, dismissal or termination etc.
A unique identifier for this contact.
A name, expressed as text, of this contact person.
A telephone code information for this contact.
A fax code information for this contact.
A uniform Resource Identifier (URI) code information for this contact such as a web or an email address.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Multi Currency Amount. Functional Amount. Functional_ Amount
Multi Currency Amount. Transaction Amount. Transaction_ Amount
Multi Currency Amount. Reporting Amount. Reporting_ Amount
Multi Currency Amount. Local Amount. Local_ Amount

data.Description: The unique identifier for the person who did the handling.Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the User_ID in the BAS_User table.
The date of handling.This should be a system generated date (rather than user-created date), when possible. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date.
The time of handling.
UN00001268 The unique identifier for this accounting account.
UN00002146 The name, expressed as text, of this accounting account.
ADCS-00120 A label or description associated with this accounting account
UN00001270 The code specifying the type of accounting account such as general(main), secondary, cost accounting, budget account.
ADCS-00119 A code of subtype for this accounting account.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Account. Financial Statement Caption. Text
data.Description: ADCS-00121 A financial statement caption represents a related group of accounts.
ADCS-00122 A corresponding level for account number in the account hierarchy.
ADCS-00123 This indicates whether this accounting account is active or inactive.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Account. Balance Normal Sign. Code
data.Description: UN00004792 The code specifying the balance normal sign of this accounting account, such as debit or credit (reference UNCL 4405).
ADCS-00118 A reference identifier for this accounting sub account.
UN00002152 The unique identifier for this accounting entry.
UN00002158 The reference identifier of an entry related to this accounting entry.
UN00002153 The code specifying the processing status for this accounting entry, such as validated, not validated, proposed, simulated, deferred, or removed.
UN00002159 The code specifying the category of this accounting entry, such as financial accounting, budget, comparison, standard, recurring, or reordered.
UN00002160 The purpose, expressed as text, for this accounting entry.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Entry. Value Date. Date Time
data.Description: UN00002155 The date, time, date time, or other date time value of the value date of this accounting entry.
UN00002161 The date, time, date time, or other date time value of the capture of this accounting entry.
UN00002162 The date, time, date time, or other date time value for the reversal of this accounting entry.
UN00002163 The date, time, date time, or other date time value for the validation of this accounting entry.
UN00002156 The indication of whether or not this accounting entry must be removed.
UN00002157 The indication of whether or not the debit and credit amounts of this accounting entry are unbalanced.
ADCS-00131 A [Specified] code for this accounting entry.
ADCS-00132 A [Specified] text for this accounting entry.
ADCS-00133 A [Specified] date for this accounting entry.
ADCS-00134 A [Specified] numeric vallue for this accounting entry.
ADCS-00135 A [Specified] indicator for this accounting entry.
ADCS-00136 A reference identifier to [Specified Class] for this accounting entry.
ADCS-00137 An accounting period specified for this accounting entry.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Entry. Detailed. Accounting Entry Line
data.Description: UN00002164 A detailed accounting line entry for this accounting entry.
UN00005780 A document that provides the justification for this accounting entry.
UN00002154 The unique identifier of the journal for this accounting entry.
UN00007073 A journal specified for this accounting entry.
ADCS-00139 A unique identifier for this accounting entry line.
UN00002166 The comment, expressed as text, for this accounting entry line.

UN00002167 The code specifying the category of this accounting entry line, such as opening balance, normal, simulation, paid commercial paper not yet due from a prior period, not matched line in a prior period, or not reconciled line in a prior period.
UN00002168 The code specifying the source of this accounting entry line, such as year to date, import, or manual input.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Entry Line. Last Change. Date Time
data.Description: UN00002169 The date, time, date time, or other date time value of the last change to this accounting entry line.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Entry Line. Last Change Responsible Person Name. Text
data.Description: UN00002170 The name or initials of the person, expressed as text, responsible for the last change to this accounting entry line.
UN00003222 The actual quantity for this accounting entry line.
ADCS-00140 A reference identifier for document reference identifier for this accounting entry line.
UN00007068 A nature, expressed as text, of an accounting entry line, such as a product or service description.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Entry Line. Repeated. Monetary Allocation
data.Description: UN00002172 A repeated monetary allocation for this accounting entry line.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Entry Line. Repeated. Monetary Instalment
data.Description: UN00002173 A repeated monetary instalment for this accounting entry line.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Entry Line. Related. Quantity Analysis
data.Description: UN00002174 The quantity analysis related to this accounting entry line.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Entry Line. Related. Accounting Line Monetary Value
data.Description: UN00002175 An accounting line monetary value related to this accounting entry line.
UN00002176 A tax related to this accounting entry line.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Entry Line. Connected. Accounting Entry
data.Description: UN00005779 An accounting entry to which this accounting entry line is connected.
UN00007072 A payment repeated for this accounting entry line.
Name of the contact.
The phone number of the contact.
The email address of the contact.
The unique identifier for the contract. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The number of the contract. This number is generated either by manual input or generated by the system.
The name of contract type used in sales or purchase activities; for example, framework agreement, short-term contract.
The beginning date of the contract.
The ending date of the contract.
The unique identifier for the receiving customer. Typically autogenerated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.
The unique identifier for the supplier account in the purchase contract. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the

data.DictionaryEntryName: Contract. Related. Sales Organization_ Business Segment Code
data.Description: The unique code of the sales organization which signed the contract. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Contract. Related. Purchase Organization_ Business Segment Code
data.Description: The unique code of the purchase organization which signed the contract. Shall match the Unique_Bus_Seg_Code in the AS_Business_Segment table.
The unique identifier for the salesperson. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.
The code of the person who is responsible for purchase contracts. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.

The code value or indicator of the method by which the transaction (i.e. the debit or credit amount) amount was extinguished or apportioned to the debt by the customer or the supplier. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.
The code of the payment term. Shall match the Payment_Term_Code in the BAS_Payment_Term table; for example, cash on delivery, payment 30 days after delivery date.
The transactional currency specified in the contract (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Cuurency table.
The status of the contract; for example, new, save, submit and frozen.
Freeform text description.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the contract. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Contract_ID in the Sales or Purchase Contracts table.
The unique identifier for a contract line. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Contract Line. Contract Line Number. Text
data.Description: The number of a contract line. The number is usually generated by manual input or is system generated; for example, including contract ID, date and serial number.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Contract Line. Settlement Organization Code. Identifier
data.Description: The unique code of the settlement organization. Both parties have settlement unit code, which is used to identify an organization for sales order settlement. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Contract Line. Dispatch Organization Code. Identifier
data.Description: The unique code of the dispatch organization. The dispatch unit refers to the unit who send out goods belonging to the seller. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the Business_Segment_Master table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Contract Line. Receipt Organization Code. Identifier
data.Description: The unique code of the receiving materials organization (Receiving organization, can be different from the settlement organization). The organization receiving materials may be a warehouse or an administration organization. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.
The unique identifier for the product. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID in the INV_Product table.
The quantity of the product in the contract.
The code of the measurement unit for the product. Shall match the UOM_Code in the

data.DictionaryEntryName: Contract Line. Tax Exclude Unit Price. Unit Amount
data.Description: The unit price (excluding tax) in transaction currency.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Contract Line. Tax Include Unit Price. Unit Amount
data.Description: The unit price (including tax) in transaction currency.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Contract Line. Tax Exclude Amount. Amount
data.Description: The amount (excluding tax) in transaction currency.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Contract Line. Tax Include Amount. Amount
data.Description: The amount (including tax) in transaction currency.
The last requested delivery of products; for example, when an order is delivered in multiple batches, this field refers to the time for the delivery of the last batch.
The status of the contract; for example, new, save, submit and frozen.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Contract Line. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the invoice. Typically auto-generated by the system. The same ID shall be used for all tables with invoice data.
The number of the invoice. The number is usually generated by manual input or is system generated; for example, including serial number, document type and date.

Fiscal year in which Invoice_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Accounting period in which the Invoice_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.
The unique official code of the invoice, which is usually generated by the tax authoritites.
The name of the invoice type. The documents are classified according to business content.
The date of the invoice, regardless of the date the invoice is created. This is the date from which the due date is calculated based on the invoice terms.
The date payment is due from the customer. Aging of a receivable is usually calculated based on this date.
The unique identifier for the receiving customer. Typically autogenerated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.

The unique identifier for the supplier to whom payment is due or from whom unused credits have been applied. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Invoice. Related. Settlement Organization_ Business Segment
data.Description: The unique code of the settlement organization (Organization of the payment, can be different from the receiving organization). May be the purchase organization or the receipt organization. Shall match the Unique_Bus_Seg_Code in the
The code value of the method used for cash receipts from customers. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.

The transaction monetary amount recorded in the functional or group currency. No multi-currency translation should be performed on this amount because all transactions are recorded in a single currency.
The transactional currency appeared in the invoice (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.
The code of the payment term. Shall match the Payment_Term_Code in the BAS_Payment_Term table; for example, cash on delivery, payment 30 days after delivery date.
The discount percentage can be provided if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days. Terms are represented as integers to decimal; for example, 10% would be represented as 0.10.

The number of days from the invoice date that the customer has to take advantage of discounted terms. Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places; for example, 10 would represent 10 days.
The number of days allowed that the customer has to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.
Grouping mechanism for related items in a batch or grouping of invoices, for example, the invoice grouping found in certain ERP systems.
The status of the generated invoice; for example, new, save, submit and frozen.
Freeform text description.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the invoice. Typically auto-generated by the system. The same ID shall be used for all tables with invoice data. Shall match the Invoice_ID in the Invoices_Generated table.
The unique identifier for an invoice line. Typically autogenerated by the system.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Invoice Line. Invoice Line Number. Text
data.Description: The number of an internally generated invoice line. This number is generated either by manual input or generated by the system.
The unique identifier for the order. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if there is no order. Otherwise shall match the Order_ID in the Orders table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Invoice Line. Order Line ID. Order Line
data.Description: The unique identifier for a order line. Typically autogenerated by the system. May be set to NULL if there is no order. Otherwise shall match the Order_Line_ID in the Orders_Details table.
The unique identifier for the product. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID in the INV_Product table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Invoice Line. Basic UOM_ Quantity. Quantity
data.Description: The quantity by basic measurement unit.
The code of the basic measurement unit in invoice, which cannot be further seperated. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.
The quantity recorded in the invoice line by the measurement unit for product.
The code of the measurement unit for the product. Shall match the UOM_Code in the

data.DictionaryEntryName: Invoice Line. Tax Exclude. Unit Price
data.Description: The unit price (excluding tax) in transaction currency.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Invoice Line. Tax Include. Unit Price
data.Description: The unit price (including tax) in transaction currency.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Invoice Line. Tax Exclude Amount. Amount
data.Description: The amount (excluding tax) in transaction currency.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Invoice Line. Tax Include Amount. Amount
data.Description: The amount (including tax) in transaction currency.

The transaction monetary amount recorded in the functional or group currency. No multi-currency translation should be performed on this amount because all transactions are recorded in a single currency.
Grouping mechanism for related items in a batch or grouping of invoices, for example, the invoice grouping found in the certain ERP systems.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Invoice Line. Defined. Debit_ Chart Of Accounts
data.Description: The number of GL account on which the debit side of the transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Invoice Line. Defined. Credit_ Chart Of Accounts
data.Description: The number of GL account on which the credit side of the transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Invoice Line. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the order. Typically auto-generated by the system.
The number of the order. This number is generated either by manual input or generated by the system.

Fiscal year in which the order occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

Accounting period in which the Order_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

The name of the order in sales activities. The types of orders are usually allocated by users of the system according to different business needs; for example, some enterprises will be configured as non contract orders, trial orders, factory orders and store orders.
The date of signing the order. It is the effective date of the order, not the system entered date. The order of a certain period is counted based on the effective date.
The unique code of the sales organization which signed the order. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.
The unique identifier for the salesperson. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.
The code of the person who responsible for purchase orders. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.
The unique identifier for the receiving customer. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.
The unique identifier for the supplier account in the purchase order. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the

The code value or indicator of the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount (i.e. the debit or credit amount) was extinguished or apportioned to the debt by the customer or the supplier. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.
The code of the payment term. Shall match the Payment_Term_Code in the BAS_Payment_Term table; for example, cash on delivery, payment 30 days after delivery date.
The monetary amount recorded in transaction currency.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order. Order Transaction_ Currency Code. (Component of Code)
data.Description: The transactional currency code specified in the order (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.
The status of the order; for example, the order has been shipped (goods on the way), the order has been collected, and the order has been completed.
Freeform text description.

A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
The unique identifier for the order. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Order_ID in the order table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Order Line ID. Identifier
data.Description: The unique identifier for a order line. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Order Line Number. Text
data.Description: The line number of the order. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.
The unique identifier for the contract. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if there is no sales contract. Otherwise shall match the Contract_ID in the Contracts_Details table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Contract Line ID. Identifier
data.Description: The unique identifier for a contract line. Typically auto generated by the system. Shall match the Contract_Line_ID in the Contracts_Details table.

The unique identifier for the material purchase requisition. Typically autogenerated by the system. May be set to NULL if no transaction related purchase requisitions. Otherwise shall match the Requisition_ID in the PUR_Requisitions table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Requisition Line ID. Identifier
data.Description: The unique identifier for a material purchase requisition line. A requisition form may apply for purchasing one or more materials. Each material requisitioned should be described in a seperate row. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if no transaction related purchase requisitions. Otherwise shall match the Requisition_Line_ID in the PUR_Requisitions_Details table.

The unique identifier for the payer. Typically auto-generated by the system. There are different purchase models in the group company, for example, centralized purchase, decentralized payment, decentralization of procurement and centralized payment. If the sales order customer adopts the centralized purchasing mode, the customer may be a group company, and the settlement organization may be a subsidiary company of the group company. The customer name and the name of the payment customer may be different.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Settlement Organization Code. Identifier
data.Description: The unique code of the settlement organization. Both parties have settlement unit code, which is used to identify an organization for sales order settlement. Shall match the Settlement_Organization_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Dispatch Organization Code. Identifier
data.Description: The unique code of the dispatch organization. The dispatch unit refers to the unit who send out goods unit belonging to the seller. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the Business_Segment_Master table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Receipt Organization Code. Identifier
data.Description: The unique code of the receiving materials organization (Receiving organization, can be different from the settlement organization). The organization receiving materials may be a warehouse or an administration organization. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.
The unique identifier for the project. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Project_ID in the BAS_Project table.
The last requested delivery of products. When an order is delivered in multiple batches, this field refers to the time for the delivery of the last batch.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Basic UOM_ Quantity. Quantity
data.Description: The quantity by basic measurement unit.
The code of the basic measurement unit in order, which cannot be further seperated. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Order Line_ Quantity. Quantity
data.Description: The quantity of the order line by the measurement unit in order line.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Order Line_ . (Component of Quantity)
data.Description: The code of the measurement unit in order line. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Tax Exclude Unit Price. Unit Amount
data.Description: The unit price (excluding tax) in transaction currency.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Tax Include Unit Price. Unit Amount
data.Description: The unit price (including tax) in transaction currency.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Tax Exclude Amount. Amount
data.Description: The amount (excluding tax) in transaction currency.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Tax Include Amount. Amount
data.Description: The amount (including tax) in transaction currency.
The unique identifier for the product. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID in the INV_Product table.
The transaction currency amount of order line.
The status of the document line; for example, new, save, submit and frozen.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Order Line. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.
A unique identifier of the party.
An identification, expressed as code, for this party.
A code specifying the type of party that is independent of its role.
A name, expressed as text, for this party.
A textual description of this party.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Party. Assigned To Role. Date Time
data.Description: The date, time, date time or other date time value when this role was assigned to the party.
A role, expressed as text, for this party.
A group, expressed as text, for this party.
A party that is a parent of this party.
This indicates whether the Regulator is active or inactive.
A specified code value for this party.
A specified amount value for this party.
A specified date for this party.
A specified percentage for this party.
A specified numeric value for this party.
A specified text for this party.
A specified reference identifier for this party.
A contact information for this party.
An address specified for this party.
A physical address for this party.
A billing address for this party.
A user activity performed for this party.
A party associated with this party, such as a local agent of a shipping line.
